verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke his word to me:

verses.kjv: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the LORD; I remember thee, the kindness of thy youth, the love of thine espousals, when thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.
verses.web: “Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, ‘LORD says, “I remember for you the kindness of your youth, the love of your weddings; how you went after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.
verses.ct: "Go and announce this where all Jerusalem can hear: The LORD says, 'I remember how devoted you were when you were young — how you loved me like a new bride. You followed me through the wilderness, through a land where nothing grew.

verses.kjv: Israel was holiness unto the LORD, and the firstfruits of his increase: all that devour him shall offend; evil shall come upon them, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Israel was holiness to LORD, the first fruits of his increase. All who devour him will be held guilty. Evil will come on them,” ’ says LORD.”
verses.ct: Israel was set apart for the LORD, the first and best of his harvest. Anyone who devoured them was held guilty, and disaster came upon them,'" says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Hear ye the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:
verses.web: Hear LORD’s word, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel!
verses.ct: Listen to the LORD's word, descendants of Jacob — all you families of Israel!

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, What iniquity have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked after vanity, and are become vain?
verses.web: LORD says, “What unrighteousness have your fathers found in me, that they have gone far from me, and have walked after worthless vanity, and have become worthless?
verses.ct: The LORD says: "What fault did your ancestors find in me that they drifted so far away? They chased after worthless idols and became worthless themselves.

verses.kjv: Neither said they, Where is the LORD that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought, and of the shadow of death, through a land that no man passed through, and where no man dwelt?
verses.web: They didn’t say, ‘Where is LORD who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that no one passed through, and where no man lived?’
verses.ct: They never asked, 'Where is the LORD who brought us out of Egypt? Where is the one who led us through the wilderness — through barren deserts and deep ravines, through drought and the shadow of death, through land no one had ever crossed, where no one had ever lived?'

verses.kjv: And I brought you into a plentiful country, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye defiled my land, and made mine heritage an abomination.
verses.web: I brought you into a plentiful land to eat its fruit and its goodness; but when you entered, you defiled my land, and made my heritage an abomination.
verses.ct: I brought you into a rich and fertile land to enjoy its fruit and abundance. But the moment you arrived, you defiled my land and turned my inheritance into something disgusting.

verses.kjv: The priests said not, Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.
verses.web: The priests didn’t say, ‘Where is LORD?’ and those who handle the law didn’t know me. The rulers also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal and followed things that do not profit.
verses.ct: The priests never asked, 'Where is the LORD?' Those who taught the law didn't know me. The leaders rebelled against me, and the prophets prophesied in Baal's name, chasing after gods that are completely useless.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will yet plead with you, saith the LORD, and with your children’s children will I plead.
verses.web: “Therefore I will yet contend with you,” says LORD, “and I will contend with your children’s children.
verses.ct: "So I will bring charges against you," says the LORD, "and against your children's children I will bring charges.

verses.kjv: For pass over the isles of Chittim, and see; and send unto Kedar, and consider diligently, and see if there be such a thing.
verses.web: For pass over to the islands of Kittim, and see. Send to Kedar, and consider diligently, and see if there has been such a thing.
verses.ct: Cross the sea to the coasts of Kittim and look around. Send someone to Kedar and investigate carefully. See if anything like this has ever happened.

verses.kjv: Hath a nation changed their gods, which are yet no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which doth not profit.
verses.web: Has a nation changed its gods, which really are no gods? But my people have changed their glory for that which doesn’t profit.
verses.ct: Has any nation ever traded its gods for new ones — even though their gods aren't real? Yet my people have traded their glory for gods that are completely worthless.

verses.kjv: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “Be astonished, you heavens, at this and be horribly afraid. Be very desolate,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Be stunned at this, you heavens! Shudder in absolute horror," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: For my people have committed two evils; they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters, and hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.
verses.web: “For my people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me, the spring of living waters, and cut out cisterns for themselves: broken cisterns that can’t hold water.
verses.ct: "My people have committed two evils: they have abandoned me — the fountain of living waters — and they have dug their own cisterns, cracked cisterns that can't hold water.

verses.kjv: Is Israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave? why is he spoiled?
verses.web: Is Israel a slave? Is he born into slavery? Why has he become a captive?
verses.ct: Is Israel a slave? Was he born into slavery? Then why has he been plundered?

verses.kjv: The young lions roared upon him, and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are burned without inhabitant.
verses.web: The young lions have roared at him and yelled. They have made his land waste. His cities are burned up, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: Young lions have roared over him and growled. They've turned his land into a wasteland. His cities are burned and empty.

verses.kjv: Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.
verses.web: The children also of Memphis and Tahpanhes have broken the crown of your head.
verses.ct: The men of Memphis and Tahpanhes have cracked your skull.

verses.kjv: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, when he led thee by the way?
verses.web: “Haven’t you brought this on yourself, in that you have forsaken LORD your God, when he led you by the way?
verses.ct: Haven't you brought this on yourself by abandoning the LORD your God while he was leading you along the way?

verses.kjv: And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt, to drink the waters of Sihor? or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria, to drink the waters of the river?
verses.web: Now what do you gain by going to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? Or why do you to go on the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
verses.ct: So what do you gain by running to Egypt to drink from the waters of Shihor? And what do you gain by running to Assyria to drink from the Euphrates?

verses.kjv: Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts.
verses.web: “Your own wickedness will correct you, and your backsliding will rebuke you. Know therefore and see that it is an evil and bitter thing, that you have forsaken LORD your God, and that my fear is not in you,” says the Lord, LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: Your own wickedness will discipline you, and your unfaithfulness will punish you. Understand this and see it clearly: it is an evil and bitter thing that you have abandoned the LORD your God, and that the fear of me is not in you," says the Lord GOD of hosts.

verses.kjv: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bands; and thou saidst, I will not transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree thou wanderest, playing the harlot.
verses.web: “For long ago I broke off your yoke, and burst your bonds. You said, ‘I will not serve;’ for on every high hill and under every green tree you bowed yourself, playing the prostitute.
verses.ct: "Long ago I broke your yoke and snapped your chains. You said, 'I won't disobey!' But then on every hilltop and under every green tree, you sprawled out and played the prostitute.

verses.kjv: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?
verses.web: Yet I had planted you a noble vine, a pure and faithful seed. How then have you turned into the degenerate branches of a foreign vine to me?
verses.ct: I planted you as a choice vine, from the purest seed. So how have you turned into a wild, rotten vine that I don't even recognize?

verses.kjv: For though thou wash thee with nitre, and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: For though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap, yet your iniquity is marked before me,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: Even if you scrub yourself with lye and pile on the soap, the stain of your guilt is still right there in front of me," says the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: How canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
verses.web: “How can you say, ‘I am not defiled. I have not gone after the Baals’? See your way in the valley. Know what you have done. You are a swift dromedary traversing her ways,
verses.ct: "How can you say, 'I'm not defiled — I haven't chased after the Baals'? Look at what you've done in the valley. Face what you are: a restless young camel running wild in every direction,

verses.kjv: A wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure; in her occasion who can turn her away? all they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.
verses.web: a wild donkey used to the wilderness, that sniffs the wind in her craving. When she is in heat, who can turn her away? All those who seek her will not weary themselves. In her month, they will find her.
verses.ct: a wild donkey at home in the desert, sniffing the wind in her lust. When she's in heat, who can hold her back? No one who wants her needs to tire himself out searching — when her time comes, they'll find her easily.

verses.kjv: Withhold thy foot from being unshod, and thy throat from thirst: but thou saidst, There is no hope: no; for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.
verses.web: “Keep your feet from being bare, and your throat from thirst. But you said, ‘It is in vain. No, for I have loved strangers, and I will go after them.’
verses.ct: "Stop running until your sandals wear out and your throat is parched with thirst! But you said, 'It's no use. I love these foreign gods, and I'm going after them.'

verses.kjv: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets,
verses.web: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so the house of Israel is ashamed: they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets,
verses.ct: Like a thief who feels shame only when he's caught, so the house of Israel is put to shame — their kings, their officials, their priests, and their prophets.

verses.kjv: Saying to a stock, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto me, and not their face: but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.
verses.web: who tell wood, ‘You are my father,’ and a stone, ‘You have given birth to me,’ for they have turned their back to me, and not their face; but in the time of their trouble they will say, ‘Arise, and save us!’
verses.ct: They say to a wooden idol, 'You are my father,' and to a stone, 'You gave birth to me.' They've turned their backs to me instead of their faces. But when trouble comes, suddenly they cry out, 'Get up and save us!'

verses.kjv: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble: for according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah.
verses.web: “But where are your gods that you have made for yourselves? Let them arise, if they can save you in the time of your trouble; for you have as many gods as you have towns, O Judah.
verses.ct: "Where are the gods you made for yourselves? Let them get up and save you when trouble strikes — if they can! Because you have as many gods as you have cities, Judah.

verses.kjv: Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “Why will you contend with me? You all have transgressed against me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Why are you arguing with me? Every one of you has rebelled against me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: In vain have I smitten your children; they received no correction: your own sword hath devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.
verses.web: “I have struck your children in vain. They received no correction. Your own sword has devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.
verses.ct: "I punished your children, but it did no good — they refused to learn. Your own sword devoured your prophets like a ravaging lion.

verses.kjv: O generation, see ye the word of the LORD. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? a land of darkness? wherefore say my people, We are lords; we will come no more unto thee?
verses.web: Generation, consider LORD’s word. Have I been a wilderness to Israel? Or a land of thick darkness? Why do my people say, ‘We have broken loose. We will come to you no more?’
verses.ct: You people of this generation, pay attention to the LORD's word! Have I been a wasteland to Israel? Have I been a land of total darkness? Then why do my people say, 'We're free to do as we please — we're done coming to you'?

verses.kjv: Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
verses.web: “Can a virgin forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? Yet my people have forgotten me for days without number.
verses.ct: "Does a young woman forget her jewelry? Does a bride forget her wedding dress? Yet my people have forgotten me for more days than anyone can count.

verses.kjv: Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love? therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.
verses.web: How well you prepare your way to seek love! Therefore you have even taught the wicked women your ways.
verses.ct: How skillfully you plot your course to chase after lovers! You've become so practiced at it that you could teach even the most wicked women your tricks.

verses.kjv: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents: I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.
verses.web: Also the blood of the souls of the innocent poor is found in your skirts. You didn’t find them breaking in, but it is because of all these things.
verses.ct: The blood of innocent poor people stains your clothes. You didn't catch them breaking into your home — yet you killed them anyway. And despite all this —

verses.kjv: Yet thou sayest, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me. Behold, I will plead with thee, because thou sayest, I have not sinned.
verses.web: “Yet you said, ‘I am innocent. Surely his anger has turned away from me.’ “Behold, I will judge you, because you say, ‘I have not sinned.’
verses.ct: you still say, 'I'm innocent. Surely God isn't angry with me anymore.' But watch — I am going to judge you precisely because you keep saying, 'I have not sinned.'

verses.kjv: Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way? thou also shalt be ashamed of Egypt, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
verses.web: Why do you go about so much to change your ways? You will be ashamed of Egypt also, as you were ashamed of Assyria.
verses.ct: Why do you keep running from one alliance to another, constantly changing course? You'll be humiliated by Egypt just as you were humiliated by Assyria.

verses.kjv: Yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hands upon thine head: for the LORD hath rejected thy confidences, and thou shalt not prosper in them.
verses.web: You will also leave that place with your hands on your head; for LORD has rejected those in whom you trust, and you won’t prosper with them.
verses.ct: You'll leave that place too with your hands on your head in shame, because the LORD has rejected the nations you're trusting in. They will do you no good at all.
